Learn

start
↓

Is the child unable to breastfeed or drink?

Is the child vomiting?

Is the child having convulsions?

Is the child lethargic or unconscious?

Yes to any
No to all
↓
Move on to next module
↓

Classification:

General Danger Sign

↓

Treat General Danger Sign:

Test for low blood sugar and treat if present.

Give Oxygen if the child is lethargic or unconscious.

↓

GDS means

also classify as:

Severe Pnemonia,

Suspected Meningitis,

Suspected Severe Malaria,

Suspected Complicated Measles.

↓
Treat all above classifications. Complete assesment by advancing to next module.
